summary: George Bookasta  was an American child actor.
full_text:
George Bookasta  was an American child actor and director who was discovered by Charlie Chaplin. He signed a contract with the film studio United Artists and debuted in the silent film Rosita in 1923. Some of his other films included The Night Bird, Hell Harbor and It Had to Happen. Bookasta was a stand-in in Sergeant York in 1941.
As an adult, he created the magazine TV Times, directed episodes for television shows such as The Colgate Comedy Hour and Bachelor Father and led a bigband orchestra in New York.
Bookasta died March 26, 2014 at the age of 96.
title: George Bookasta
